intro: Senecio brachychaetus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and daisy-like appearance. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has linear, hairy leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Senecio brachychaetus is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
